description: Add Only Flag.  Indicates that the service is an add only, not an update.

Facilities_and_Admin_ExceptionObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Facilities_and_Admin_ExceptionObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Facilities_and_Admin_ExceptionObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Reference to an existing Facilities and Admin Exception for update purposes only.

Facilities_and_Admin_Exception_Data.description: This is the unique identifier for F&A Exception.
Set to True to disable editing the F&A Exception inside the Workday application.
The name of the F&A Exception.

Facilities_and_Admin_Basis_TypeObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Facilities_and_Admin_Basis_TypeObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Facilities_and_Admin_Basis_TypeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Facilities_and_Admin_Exception_Data.description: Reference to an existing F&A Basis Type.  Basis Type identifies the valid set of Object Classes to be used for this F&A Exception.

Facilities_and_Admin_Exception_TypeObjec.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Facilities_and_Admin_Exception_Data.description: The primary type for the F&A Exception.  If an exception type indicating an Facilities and Administration rate override is selected, every transaction against the award will use the primary rate on the exception for Facilities and Administration calculations, unless a Facilities and Administration Exception Detail for the Object Class for the Transaction specifies another rate to use.  If an exception type indicating an Facilities and Administration waive rate is selected, every transaction against the award will use the primary waive rate on the exception for Facilities and Administration calculations, unless a Facilities and Administration Exception Detail for the Object Class for the Transaction specifies another waive rate to use.
Rate as percent entered in decimal format, ex: enter 1 for 100%, .5 for 50%, etc
Rate as percent entered in decimal format, ex: enter 1 for 100%, .5 for 50%, etc

Facilities_and_Admin_Waived_Expense_Allo.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Facilities_and_Admin_Exception_Data.description: Reference to the Facilities and Administration Waived Expense Allocation Profile which allocates costs for Facilities and Administration Excptions that waive any portion Facilities and Administration costs.

Facilities_and_Admin_Exception_DetailObj.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Facilities_and_Admin_Exception_Detail_Da.description: This reference for the Facilities and Administration Exception Detail for update.  If no reference specified, a new reference will be created.

Object_ClassObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Object_ClassObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Object_ClassObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Facilities_and_Admin_Exception_Detail_Da.description: Reference to an existing Object Class.  Only Object Classes defined on the Basis Type referenced in the Facilities and Admin Exception Data are valid.

Facilities_and_Admin_Exception_TypeObjec.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Facilities_and_Admin_Exception_Detail_Da.description: The Facilities and Administration Exception Type for the Exception Detail.  The rate at which Facilities and Administration is calculated and/or waived can be overridden at the Object Class level.  If an exception type that overrides the Facilities and Administration rate is chosen, transactions against and award line that have the object class for the Facilities and Administration Exception Detail will use the rate specified on the exception detail for Facilities and Administration calculations. If an exception type that waives Facilities and Administration is chosen, transactions against and award line that have the object class for the Facilities and Administration Exception Detail will use the rate specified on the exception detail calculating waived Facilities and Administration.
Rate for the Object Class reference as percent entered in decimal format, ex: enter 1 for 100%, .5 for 50%, etc.
Rate for the Object Class reference as percent entered in decimal format, ex: enter 1 for 100%, .5 for 50%, etc.

Facilities_and_Admin_Exception_Data.description: Wrapper element containing exception rates by object class.

validation.validation: Facilities and Administration Exception Detail Data cannot be changed because it is referenced by an approved or amended Award.  (Exception: [exception]; Object Class: [object])
The Object Class has already been specified for this exception.  Object class must be unique per exception.  (Object class: [object])
Object Class specified is not valid for the Basis Type.  Only object classes defined for the Basis Type are allowed. (Object Class: [object])
The Facilities and Admin Exception Type entered must be valid for use on Facilities and Admin Exception Details.

If the Facilities and Administration Exception Type Entered does not indicate that the Facilities and Administration Exception Detail should provide an Override Rate, then the Override Rate entered must be 0.

If the Facilities and Administration Exception Type Entered does not indicate that the Facilities and Administration Exception Detail should provide a Waive Rate, then the Waive Rate entered must be 0.

description: Element containing Facilities and Admin Exception Data

validation.validation: Facilities and Administration Exception data cannot be changed because it is referenced by an approved or amended Award.  (Exception: [exception])
Cannot delete the Facilities and Administration exception detail reference because the exception is referenced on an approved Award.
The Facilities and Admin Exception Type entered must be valid for use on F&A Exceptions.

If the Facilities and Administration Exception Type Entered does not indicate that the Facilities and Administration Exception should provide an Override F&A Rate, then the Override F&A Rate entered must be 0.
If the Facilities and Administration Exception Type Entered does not indicate that the Facilities and Administration Exception should provide a Waive Rate, then the Waive Rate entered must be 0.
If the Facilities and Administration Exception is configured to waive Facilities and Admin costs, it must have an associated Waived Expense Allocation Profile.
